creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: a group of young men (wearing light clothing) and women (in blue and white summer kimono) attempt to skim goldfish out of an elevated pond with white nets while others gather on all sides to look on; at LL, a collection of potted plants and a basket of goods
inscription: left: 自摺　昭和三年作　東京拾二題　金魚すくい {jizuri, Shōwa sannen saku, Tōkyō jūnidai, Kingyō sukui}
markings: LRC, red artist\'s seal A: 博 {Hiroshi}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on silk
portfolio: From Twelve Scenes of Tokyo (Tōkyō jūnidai 東京拾二題)
title: Dipping for Goldfish
